newsitem.title: USA: ACI Telecentrics buys telemarketing firm.
newsitem.headline: ACI Telecentrics buys telemarketing firm.

text.p: ACI Telecentrics Inc said Monday it has acquired BRITCOM, a teleservices company with call centers in Lombard, Ill. and Merrilville, Ind. for an initial cash payment of about $1.25 million.
The final purchase price is based on BRITCOM achieving specific revenue targets in 1998 and could be up to $3 million.

BRITCOM, a subsidiary of Encyclopaedia Britannica, Inc., provides telemarketing services primarily to the insurance industry. Its two call centers include about 200 outbound and 30 inbound call stations, which will bring ACI's total to over 500 call stations.
BRITCOM had revenues in 1996 of about $6 million and employs 300 people in Lombard and Merrilville. The new call centers will conduct business under the ACI Telecentrics name.
"This acquisition gives ACI a foothold in the insurance industry with a strong performer while also giving us added call station capacity," said ACI President Gary Cohen.
"In addition it also gives us an entree into the inbound call services market, which we had established as a goal in 1997," he said in a news release.
ACI provides outbound teleservices to clients primarily in the telecommunications, financial services and publishing industries through seven call centers in the Midwest.
Shares of ACI closed at five on August 1.
